Body.Description: Add a new iSCSI software adapter on selected host. The input parameters required are datacenter and host. On successful execution, adapter name, adapter model, iSCSI name, iSCSI alias, adapter status, and authentication method are generated as outputs.

OutputDefinition.Label: Adapter Name
OutputDefinition.Name: AdapterName

OutputDefinition.Description: Model of the iSCSI software adapter
OutputDefinition.Label: Adapter Model
OutputDefinition.Name: AdapterModel

OutputDefinition.Description: iSCSI name of the software adapter
OutputDefinition.Label: iSCSI Name

OutputDefinition.Description: iSCSI alias of the software adapter

OutputDefinition.Label: Adapter Status
OutputDefinition.Name: AdapterStatus

OutputDefinition.Description: Authentication settings of the iSCSI software adapter
OutputDefinition.Label: Authentication Method
OutputDefinition.Name: AuthenticationMethod

TypeDefinition.Label: Port Id

TypeDefinition.Description: ID of the host group. For iSCSI ports, this number is called target ID.
TypeDefinition.Label: Host Group Number
TypeDefinition.Name: HostGroupNumber

Body.Description: Storage vendor host identifier.
Body.Label: Storage Vendor Host Identifier
Body.Name: StorageVendorHostIdentifierType

TypeDefinition.Description: Platform type of the storage device.
TypeDefinition.Label: Platform Type
TypeDefinition.Name: PlatformType

Body.Description: Storage vendor virtual machine name.
Body.Label: Storage Vendor Virtual Machine
Body.Name: StorageVendorVirtualMachineNameType

TypeDefinition.Description: Platform type of the storage device.
TypeDefinition.Label: Platform Type
TypeDefinition.Name: PlatformType

TypeDefinition.Description: StorageVirtualMachineName can be between 1 and 47 characters long depending on the device target selected it may vary and with first character being alphanumeric or underscore (_) and containing alphanumeric characters and ".", "-" or "_" allowed.
TypeDefinition.Label: Storage Virtual Machine
TypeDefinition.Name: StorageVirtualMachineName

Body.Description: Hitachi host group parameter.
Body.Label: Hitachi Host Group Option
Body.Name: HitachiHostGroupOptionType

TypeDefinition.Description: Host mode. If this attribute is omitted, Standard is set.
TypeDefinition.Label: Host Mode
TypeDefinition.Name: HostMode

TypeDefinition.Description: Number of options for setting host mode options. For the specifiable numbers, see the provisioning guide for Open Systems. When specifying this attribute, make sure to also specify the Host Mode attribute.
TypeDefinition.Label: Host Mode Options
TypeDefinition.Name: HostModeOptions

TypeDefinition.Description: When creating a host group by specifying host group number, if you want to omit the process of checking whether the host group is created, specify true. If you specify true and a host group or iSCSI target already exists for the specified host group number, the setting is overwritten. true: Does not check whether the host group has been created. false: Checks whether the host group has been created. If this attribute is omitted, false is assumed. If Host Group Number is not specified, this attribute is ignored.
TypeDefinition.Label: Quick Creating
TypeDefinition.Name: IsQuickCreating

Body.Name: NetAppInitiatorGroupOptionsType

Body.Description: Storage vendor host options.

Body.Name: StorageVendorHostOptionsType

TypeDefinition.Description: Platform type of the storage device.
TypeDefinition.Label: Platform Type
TypeDefinition.Name: PlatformType

Body.Description: Remove a storage host with host name as input. Storage host is the entity used to associate initiators to storage and expose as LUNs. Host can map to different terms for Storage vendors. For NetApp ONTAP storage this maps to iGroup. On successful execution, the host name deleted is generated as output.
Body.Label: Remove Storage Host
Body.Name: RemoveStorageHost

InputDefinition.Description: Host name must be between 1 and 63 alpha-numeric characters, and depending on the device target selected the limit may vary. The first and last character must be alphanumeric and name may also contain hyphen (-) character.
InputDefinition.Label: Host
InputDefinition.Name: HostName

InputDefinition.Description: Storage Vendor Host Identifier
InputDefinition.Label: Storage Vendor Host Identifier
InputDefinition.Name: StorageVendorHostIdentifier

InputDefinition.Description: Storage vendor virtual machine name.
InputDefinition.Label: Storage Vendor Virtual Machine
InputDefinition.Name: StorageVendorVirtualMachineName

OutputDefinition.Description: Storage Vendor Host Identifier
OutputDefinition.Label: Storage Vendor Host Identifier
OutputDefinition.Name: StorageVendorHostIdentifier

Body.Description: Create a storage host with host name and list of WWNs and IQNs to be associated with it as input. Storage host is the entity used to associate initiators to storage and expose as LUNs. Host can map to different terms for Storage vendors. For NetApp ONTAP storage this maps to iGroup. Outputs are host name, and associated IQN or WWN list.
Body.Label: New Storage Host
Body.Name: NewStorageHost

InputDefinition.Description: Enter a host name. The host name must be alphanumeric, can include 63 characters, and may contain a hyphen (-). The host name may vary depending on the selected device target.
InputDefinition.Label: Host
InputDefinition.Name: HostName

InputDefinition.Description: Storage vendor host identifier.
InputDefinition.Label: Storage Vendor Host Identifier
InputDefinition.Name: StorageVendorHostIdentifier

InputDefinition.Description: Storage vendor virtual machine name.
InputDefinition.Label: Storage Vendor Virtual Machine
InputDefinition.Name: StorageVendorVirtualMachineName

InputDefinition.Description: Sets the list of Fiber channel worldwide names (WWNs) for the new host ['1111222233336666'].
InputDefinition.Label: List of WWNs
InputDefinition.Name: WWNs

InputDefinition.Description: Sets the list of iSCSI qualified names (IQNs) for the host ['iqn.1111.com.storagearray.iscsi:name1'].
InputDefinition.Label: List of IQNs
InputDefinition.Name: IQNs

InputDefinition.Description: Storage vendor host options.
InputDefinition.Label: Storage Vendor Host Options
InputDefinition.Name: StorageVendorHostOptions

OutputDefinition.Description: Storage vendor host identifier.
OutputDefinition.Label: Storage Vendor Host Identifier
OutputDefinition.Name: StorageVendorHostIdentifier

Body.Description: Remove single host member from a host group with host name and host group name as inputs. On successful execution, the host group name and the list of hosts in the host group are generated as outputs.
Body.Label: Remove Host from Storage Host Group
Body.Name: RemoveHostFromStorageHostGroup

InputDefinition.Description: Hostgroup from which to remove host.
InputDefinition.Label: Host Group
InputDefinition.Name: HostGroupName

InputDefinition.Description: Name of the host to remove from host group.
InputDefinition.Label: Host name
InputDefinition.Name: HostName

Body.Description: Add a single host to a host group with host name and host group name as inputs. On successful execution, task generates host group name and the list of hosts in the host group as outputs. The specified host and host group must already exist. Task will fail if the host is already present in the host group.
Body.Label: Add Host to Storage Host Group
Body.Name: AddHostToStorageHostGroup

InputDefinition.Description: Existing host group to which host must be added.
InputDefinition.Label: Host Group
InputDefinition.Name: HostGroupName

InputDefinition.Description: Name of the host to add to host group.
InputDefinition.Label: Host Name
InputDefinition.Name: HostName

OutputDefinition.Description: List of hosts in the host group.
OutputDefinition.Label: Host Names
OutputDefinition.Name: HostsName

RollbackTasks.Description: Remove host from storage host group.
RollbackTasks.Name: RemoveHostFromStorageHostGroup

EnumList.Label: Use unidirectional CHAP unless prohibited by target
EnumList.Value: Use unidirectional CHAP unless prohibited by target

Body.Description: Removes an iSCSI server from an iSCSI software adapter. The input parameters required are datacenter, host, iSCSI software adapter, iSCSI server and iSCSI server port. On successful execution , iSCSI server is generated as output.
Body.Label: Remove iSCSI Server
Body.Name: RemoveISCSIServer

InputDefinition.Description: Datacenter in which the host resides
InputDefinition.Label: Datacenter
InputDefinition.Name: Datacenter

InputDefinition.Description: Host from which the iSCSI server will be removed
InputDefinition.Label: Host
InputDefinition.Name: Host

InputDefinition.Description: iSCSI Software Adapter from which the server will be removed
InputDefinition.Label: iSCSI Software Adapter
InputDefinition.Name: iSCSISoftwareAdapter

InputDefinition.Description: iSCSI server that is to be removed
InputDefinition.Label: iSCSI Server
InputDefinition.Name: iSCSIServer

InputDefinition.Description: Port configured on the iSCSI Server
InputDefinition.Label: iSCSI Server Port
InputDefinition.Name: Port

OutputDefinition.Description: iSCSI Target Server which has been removed
OutputDefinition.Label: iSCSI Server
OutputDefinition.Name: iSCSIServer

Body.Description: Adds an iSCSI server to an iSCSI software adapter for dynamic discovery of iSCSI servers. The input parameters required are datacenter, host, iSCSI software adapter, target iSCSI server, iSCSI server port and authentication properties. On successful execution of the task, iSCSI server is generated as output.
Body.Label: Add iSCSI Server
Body.Name: AddISCSIServer

InputDefinition.Description: Datacenter in which the host resides
InputDefinition.Label: Datacenter
InputDefinition.Name: Datacenter

InputDefinition.Description: Host to which the iSCSI server will be added
InputDefinition.Label: Host
InputDefinition.Name: Host

InputDefinition.Description: iSCSI Software Adapter to which the server will be added
InputDefinition.Label: iSCSI Software Adapter
InputDefinition.Name: iSCSISoftwareAdapter

InputDefinition.Description: The address of the iSCSI server that is to be added. Supported address types are IPv4 and host name
InputDefinition.Label: iSCSI Server
InputDefinition.Name: iSCSIServer

InputDefinition.Description: Port to be configured on the iSCSI Server
InputDefinition.Label: iSCSI Server Port
InputDefinition.Name: Port

InputDefinition.Description: Authentication settings of iSCSI server
InputDefinition.Label: Authentication
InputDefinition.Name: AuthenticationMethod

OutputDefinition.Description: iSCSI Server added
OutputDefinition.Label: iSCSI Server
OutputDefinition.Name: iSCSIServer

RollbackTasks.Description: Remove Server from iSCSI Software Adapter
RollbackTasks.Name: RemoveISCSIServer
